name: Apple Stuffed Pork Chops
author: Nancy Burrowes
summary: A healthy, savory apple-y stuffing. You can make a delicious gravy from the pan drippings, too, if desired!
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
In a large skillet saute onion in butter or margarine until tender
Add the bread crumbs, apples, celery, parsley and salt
Cut a large pocket in the side of each pork chop; season inside and out with salt and pepper to taste
Spoon apple mixture loosely into pockets
In skillet, heat oil to medium high and brown chops on both sides
Place browned chops in an ungreased 9x13 inch baking dish
Cover with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes
Remove cover and bake for 30 minutes longer or until juices run clear
